section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: The sentence is structurally flawed and does not make sense. It seems to have some words repeated and doesn't read properly.

section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: The section establishes the termination date as December 31, 2020. However, section 2.2(c) states that Provider shall allow the Recipient to use [ * * * ] at no cost, until December 31, 2021. This creates a contradiction as the agreement seems to terminate before the Recipient's right to use [ * * * ] expires.

section: Provider Representatives shall be dedicated to solely providing the Services to Recipient and shall not provide any such services or resources to Provider or any other customer of Provider.
explanation: This section states that provider representatives will not provide any services to any other customer. However, the definition of services within the document, states that the provider can agree to respond in good faith to any reasonable request by Recipient for access to any additional services and resources that are necessary for the operation of the Recipient and which are not currently contemplated in the Exhibit. These definitions contradict each other because it seems like the provider representatives are solely dedicated to the Services that were originally agreed upon, but if the recipient requests additional services then the provider representatives are not solely dedicated to the original services.
